description.full: This class is integrated into the openframeworks events system. When a key event (key pressed, key released) happens we record key information inside an object of the class. Used to send event messages. In the new openFrameworks release we can find a very illustrative example about how to use events in openFrameworks.

methods.name: ofKeyEventArgs
methods.parameters: ofKeyEventArgs::Type type, int key

methods.syntax: ofKeyEventArgs(type, key, keycode, scancode, codepoint, modifiers)
methods.name: ofKeyEventArgs
methods.parameters: ofKeyEventArgs::Type type, int key, int keycode, int scancode, unsigned int codepoint, int modifiers

methods.name: codepoint
methods.short: The Unicode code point you'd expect if this key combo (including modifier keys) was pressed in a text editor, or 0 for non-printable characters.

methods.name: key
methods.short: For special keys, one of OF_KEY_* ( See also: ofConstants.h). For all other keys, the Unicode code point you'd expect if this key combo (including modifier keys that may be down) was pressed in a text editor (same as codepoint).

methods.name: keycode
methods.short: The keycode returned by the windowing system, independent of any modifier keys or keyboard layout settings. For ofAppGLFWWindow this value is one of GLFW_KEY_* ( See also: glfw3.h) - typically, ASCII representation of the symbol on the physical key, so A key always returns 0x41 even if shift, alt, ctrl are down.

methods.name: scancode
methods.short: The raw scan code returned by the keyboard, OS and hardware specific.

page.document:
#class ofKeyEventArgs

##InlineDescription

##Description

This class is integrated into the openframeworks events system. When a key event (key pressed, key released) happens we record key information inside an object of the class. Used to send event messages. In the new openFrameworks release we can find a very illustrative example about how to use events in openFrameworks.

##Methods

###bool hasModifier(modifier)

_description: _

_inlined_description: _

_description: _

##Variables

###unsigned int codepoint

_inlined_description: _

The Unicode code point you'd expect if this key combo (including modifier keys) was pressed in a text editor, or 0 for non-printable characters.

_description: _

###bool isRepeat

_inlined_description: _

If this is a repeat event

_description: _

###int key

_inlined_description: _

For special keys, one of OF_KEY_* ( See also: ofConstants.h). For all other keys, the Unicode code point you'd expect if this key combo (including modifier keys that may be down) was pressed in a text editor (same as codepoint).

_description: _

###int keycode

_inlined_description: _

The keycode returned by the windowing system, independent of any modifier keys or keyboard layout settings. For ofAppGLFWWindow this value is one of GLFW_KEY_* ( See also: glfw3.h) - typically, ASCII representation of the symbol on the physical key, so A key always returns 0x41 even if shift, alt, ctrl are down.

_description: _

###int modifiers

_inlined_description: _

Key modifiers

_description: _

###int scancode

_inlined_description: _

The raw scan code returned by the keyboard, OS and hardware specific.

_description: _

###enum ofKeyEventArgs::Type type

_inlined_description: _

_description: _

##InlineDescription






##Description

This class is integrated into the openframeworks events system. When a key event (key pressed, key released) happens we record key information inside an object of the class. Used to send event messages. In the new openFrameworks release we can find a very illustrative example about how to use events in openFrameworks.
